recipes.title: Classic Chocolate Chip Cookies
recipes.ingredients:
2 1/4 cups all-purpose flour
1 cup butter
3/4 cup sugar
3/4 cup brown sugar
2 large eggs
1 tsp vanilla extract
1 tsp baking soda
1/2 tsp salt
2 cups chocolate chips
recipes.instructions:
1. Preheat oven to 375°F
2. Cream butter and sugars
3. Beat in eggs and vanilla
4. Mix in dry ingredients
5. Stir in chocolate chips
6. Drop by rounded tablespoons onto baking sheets
7. Bake for 10-12 minutes

recipes.title: Grilled Lemon Herb Chicken
recipes.ingredients:
4 chicken breasts
1/4 cup olive oil
3 lemons
4 cloves garlic
1 tbsp fresh rosemary
1 tbsp fresh thyme
Salt and pepper to taste
recipes.instructions:
1. Mix olive oil, lemon juice, herbs, and garlic
2. Marinate chicken for 2 hours
3. Preheat grill to medium-high
4. Grill chicken 6-7 minutes per side
5. Let rest 5 minutes before serving

recipes.title: Kenji's Sous Vide Ribeye Steak
recipes.ingredients:
1 large ribeye steak (1.5 to 2 inches thick)
2 tablespoons olive oil
4 sprigs fresh thyme
3 cloves garlic, crushed
2 tablespoons butter
Kosher salt
Freshly ground black pepper
recipes.instructions:
1. Preheat sous vide water bath to 129°F (54°C) for medium-rare
2. Season steak generously with salt and pepper
3. Place steak in a zipper-lock or vacuum seal bag with thyme and garlic
4. Seal bag using water displacement method or vacuum sealer
5. Cook for 1 to 2.5 hours
6. Remove steak from bag and pat very dry with paper towels
7. Heat oil in a cast iron skillet until smoking
8. Add steak and butter, sear 45 seconds per side
9. Using tongs, sear edges until browned
10. Let rest 5 minutes before slicing
11. Serve with compound butter if desired

recipes.title: Kenji's Sous Vide Chicken Breast
recipes.ingredients:
4 chicken breasts (boneless, skinless)
2 tablespoons olive oil
4 sprigs fresh herbs (thyme, rosemary, or sage)
2 cloves garlic, lightly crushed
Kosher salt
Black pepper
2 tablespoons butter for finishing
recipes.instructions:
1. Preheat sous vide water bath to 145°F (63°C)
2. Season chicken breasts generously with salt and pepper
3. Place chicken in zipper-lock or vacuum seal bags with herbs and garlic
4. Add 1 tablespoon olive oil per bag
5. Seal bags using water displacement method or vacuum sealer
6. Cook for 1.5 to 4 hours (chicken is safe to eat after 1.5 hours but can go longer)
7. Remove from bags and pat very dry with paper towels
8. Heat remaining oil in a heavy skillet over high heat until shimmering
9. Add chicken and butter, sear until golden brown (30 seconds per side)
10. Let rest 5 minutes before slicing
11. Serve with pan juices

recipes.title: Grilled Cheese
recipes.ingredients:
3 cups of shredded cheese
2 slices of bread
1 Tbsp of butter
recipes.instructions:
1. Slather butter on bread
2. Turn pan on Medium
3. Place one slice of bread in the pan, butter side down please.
4. Pour shredded cheese on top of bread. DON'T DROP ANY CHEESE PLEASE
5. Place second slice of bread on top of pile of cheese. Butter side up please.
6. Heat on each side until brown, or as dark as you like.
CUT ON DIAGONAL ONLY PLEASE

friendsNotes.comment: Very tender steak! And very easy to make!
Delicious chicken! It was hard to get a good sear on though
Would be better with peanut butter!
I missed the charcoal flavor. But it was very tasty!
Finally a recipe with enough cheese!
Nice and hearty grilled cheese! provided you can find large enough bread!
Wonderful tasting, and easy to make. I served it with rice and a salad. I might add cherry tomatoes and white wine at the end next time, to make a little sauce and deglaze the pan
